title: Convert g3.DMesh3 created with Jellyfish in Python to Rhino.Geometry.Mesh
question:
Dear community,


When using Jellyfish within Grasshopper, DMesh3 geometry is automatically converted to Rhino.Geometry.Mesh. Hence, it is compatible with all other mesh tools.

However, this does not seem to be the case when using Jellyfish in python with ghpythonlib.components. The function DMesh3Param which would do the trick is missing.

I probably overlook something trivial but I simply cannot find the solution.


Here is a minimal example of the code:


import Rhino
from Rhino.Geometry import *
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
import ghpythonlib.components as ghc

dom = ghc.ConstructDomain(0,1)
bbox = Box(rs.WorldXYPlane(), dom, dom, dom)
gyr = ghc.Jellyfish.IsoSurface(ghc.Jellyfish.Gyroid(bbox, 1, 1, 1), 20, 0.00, True, 0)
mesh_box = ghc.Jellyfish.IsoSurface(ghc.Jellyfish.ImplicitBox(bbox), 20, 0, True, 0)
M = ghc.Jellyfish.MeshMeshCut(gyr[0], mesh_box[0], False)
mesh_out = ghc.DeconstructMesh(M)



How can I convert DMesh3 to Rhino.Geometry.Mesh?


Thank you for your help!
